page.description: Inserts a button for displaying all the data in a list, including any nested array data.

discussion.p: The *[ui:List data explode]* control is a button that can be used to update a List's layout to display all data in the List. This control can be used to explore the data stored in a List control. If the List displays a subset of List data fields, it adds all fields to the layout. If the List data contains nested arrays, a checkbox will be included in the dropdown shown for the *[ui:List data explode]* button. You can include the nested array data in the List layout by checking the checkbox for the nested data and clicking "Explode".

figure.title: An exploded list that contains a nested array, "Children" (*[link:download component@components/listExplode_Simple.zip]*)

description.p: *[ui:List data explode]* can be used with any List regardless of the List's layout. Exploded data is displayed using a Columnar layout. If the List only has one layout, *[ui:List data explode]* replaces the List's layout. If the List has multiple layouts, *[ui:List data explode]* will replace the Default layout.

In addition to the fields in the data source, the *[ui:List data explode]* button may also add internal List data fields to the layout. These are used internally by Alpha Anywhere to track record-dependent information, such as the record's primary key (*[_primaryKey]*) or if the record has been modified (*[IsDirty]*). The internal fields shown are dependent on how the List is configured. It is strongly recommended that you do not directly modify these internal use only fields.
